    • Method Detail

      • add

        @Deprecated
public final void add(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull java.awt.Component component,
                                  java.lang.Object constraints)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is only used internally by the Java code and should not be used manually as it does not register the components in the list. Please use the register(Component, Object) method instead
        Overrides:
        add in class java.awt.Container
        Parameters:
        component - the component to be added
        constraints - an object expressing layout constraints for this component
        See Also:
        register(java.awt.Component, java.lang.Object)

      • register

        public void register(@NotNull
                     @NotNull java.awt.Component component,
                     java.lang.Object constraints)
        This method is a replacement for the Container.add(Component, Object) method. Appends the specified element to the end of this list of components, then adds the specified component to the end of this container. Also notifies the layout manager to add the component to this container's layout using the specified constraints object. This method changes layout-related information, and therefore, invalidates the component hierarchy. If the container has already been displayed, the hierarchy must be validated thereafter in order to display the added component.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to be added
        constraints - an object expressing layout constraints for this component
        See Also:
        Container.add(Component, Object)
